course_title: Cell & Tissue Biology for Agriculture & Veterinary Science

learning_outcomes.description: Distinguish the main tissue types (epithelia, connective tissues, bone, cartilage, muscle, nervous tissue and blood) and integumentary structures within histological sections of complex tissues and organs.
Describe the physiology of muscle and nervous tissue and how this relates to the structure of muscle and nervous tissue, respectively.
Explain the importance of homeostasis and how this is achieved through cell membrane function and cellular communication.

assessments.due_date:
28/07/2025 - 27/10/2025

Please check the Timetable on the course Blackboard site for the Due Date of each Quiz (8 in total).
assessments.task_description:
Eight (8) Quizzes relating to each of the Practical classes. Each Quiz consists of 5 multiple-choice questions. Further details will be provided on the AGRC1041 Blackboard site. Students will be given ample warning if Quiz dates have to be changed.

Quiz answers must be the work of individual students; collusion will be considered misconduct.


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
End of Semester Digital Practical Exam will cover all of the material in the histology practical classes. Further details will be provided on the AGRC1041 Blackboard site and in the Course Wrap-up lecture in Week 13.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Theory exam will cover all lectures from Week 1 through to Week 13. Further details will be provided on the AGRC1041 Blackboard site and in the Course Wrap-up lecture in Week 13.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
